key_title: Key to the genera of Dennstaedtiaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the families of ferns and allied plants

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Sori spherical, discrete, protected or not protected by reflexed flap of leaf margin
Sori linear and continuous, protected by reflexed leaf margins
Inner indusium and reflexed flap of leaf margin forming 2-valved, cup-like structure around each sorus; hairs on undersurface of lamina thin and colourless
Inner indusium absent; sori protected or not protected by reflexed flap of leaf margin; hairs on undersurface of lamina sometimes with coloured glandular tip
Rhizome with scales; fronds membranous, pale or blue-green; pinnules sessile, opposite, more than 6 mm wide; inner indusium absent
Rhizome with hairs; fronds harsh-textured, dark green; pinnules shortly stalked, alternate and less than 6 mm wide; inner indusium present
